text: Sugarloaf Creek is a pastoral region in central Victoria, Australia. It is located on the Sugarloaf Creek Road in the Shire of Mitchell local government area, from the state capital, Melbourne. At the 2016 Australian Census Sugarloaf Creek had a population of 257.https://www.communityprofile.com.au/mitchell The Sugarloaf Creek itself is a tributary of the Goulburn River in Australia. The traditional owners of Sugarloaf Creek are the Taungurong people, a part of the Kulin nation that inhabited a large portion of central Victoria including Port Phillip Bay and its surrounds. Sugarloaf Creek has the distinction of being the site of the first European settlement in inland Victoria, a sheep station, and the generator of the second and third ever European settlements in inland Victoria at Carlsruhe and Kilmore. Charles Hotson Ebden and Charles Bonney drove 10,000 sheep from Mungabareena station on the Murray on 1 March 1837 and reached Sugarloaf Creek station on about 14 March 1837. They set up their first sheep station adjacent to the intersection of Seymour Pyalong Road with Tallarook Pyalong Road, 37°05’04" S; 145°02’41" E.Williams, Martin, Charles Bonney and the fertile Kilmore Plains, Victorian Historical Journal, Volume 90, No. 1, June 2019, p. 107. Ebden shifted 9000 of the sheep to the second settlement in inland Victoria, Carlsruhe, on 26 May 1837.Walker, Thomas, A Month in the Bush of Australia, J. Crook, London, 1838, p. 34. Charles Bonney in turn drove 1000 of the sheep to Kilmore and set up the third settlement in inland Victoria, another sheep station, on about 17 June 1837.Williams, Martin, Charles Bonney and the fertile Kilmore Plains, Victorian Historical Journal, Volume 90, No. 1, June 2019, p. 108. William Hamilton took up the Sugarloaf Creek station after EbdenBride, T. F., John Hepburn, Letters from Victorian Pioneers to his Excellency Charles Joseph La Trobe, Esq., Public Library of Victoria, 1895, p.53. and remained there for the rest of his life.The Argus, 24 June 1872, p. 4 Sugarloaf Creek remains a thriving pastoral region. ==References== ==External links== Category:Rivers of Victoria (Australia) Category:Towns in Victoria (Australia)
title: Sugarloaf Creek, Victoria
